decks.notes: The Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on using low cost creatures and removal spells to pressure the opponent early in the game. By consistently playing creatures like Chittering Rats and Gray Merchant of Asphodel, along with disruption spells like Chainer's Edict and Disfigure, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The deck also includes card draw options like Sign in Blood to maintain hand advantage. With a mix of creatures and removal, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive strategy and efficient removal spells.

The deck focuses on establishing control through card advantage and removal spells, utilizing efficient creatures like Mulldrifter and Stonehorn Dignitary to stabilize the board. The Urzatron lands enable quick mana ramping to cast powerful spells like Dinrova Horror and Mnemonic Wall, while also allowing for recursion with Ephemerate and Ghostly Flicker. Mystical Teachings provides additional versatility by tutoring for key instants, while Expedition Map ensures consistency in finding Urzatron lands. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through resource management and strategic play.

The main focus of this deck is to establish board control through removal spells and creatures with built-in protection like Guardian of the Guildpact. Orzhov Pestilence is used as a win condition to slowly chip away at opponents' life totals while maintaining a board presence. The deck also includes card draw and lifegain to support its control game plan. The goal is to outvalue opponents by trading efficiently and grinding them out over the course of a long game.

This deck focuses on aggressive, low-cost creatures known as "weenies" that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes auras and combat tricks to boost the power and toughness of these creatures, enabling them to deal significant damage early on in the game. The key strategy revolves around building a wide board presence of small but potent creatures and using protection spells to keep them safe while attacking relentlessly. This deck aims to finish the game swiftly through a relentless assault of creatures buffed by enchantments.

The main concept of this deck is to flood the board with low-cost creatures and then boost their power and toughness with auras, making them difficult to deal with for the opponent. By using cards like Abundant Growth and Utopia Sprawl, the deck ensures it has the mana needed to cast multiple auras in a single turn. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures that are difficult to remove from the battlefield.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of slivers, utilizing cards like Virulent Sliver and Muscle Sliver to pump up the team and deal damage. With cards like Lead the Stampede and Winding Way to dig for more creatures, the deck aims to consistently put pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly. The mix of different slivers with various abilities adds versatility to the strategy, allowing for different lines of play depending on the situation.

This deck aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent by efficiently casting burn spells and aggressive creatures. The focus is on direct damage with cards like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt, while also utilizing creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner to apply pressure. The goal is to maintain tempo and control of the game while consistently dealing damage with burn spells and creature attacks. The deck is streamlined for fast, aggressive gameplay with the ultimate objective of reducing the opponent's life total to zero as quickly as possible.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and using them in combination with various artifacts and spells to deal large amounts of damage to the opponent. By using cards like Atog and Fling, as well as efficient card draw with Thoughtcast and Prophetic Prism, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a high volume of threats and efficient removal. Additionally, the deck includes tools such as Dispel and Galvanic Blast to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with the Urza lands to cast powerful control spells and threats such as Mulldrifter and Dinrova Horror. It also includes a variety of card draw and recursion options to outvalue opponents over the course of the game. With a few key win conditions and a flexible suite of removal and counterspells, the deck aims to slow down the game and grind out wins through superior card advantage and resource management.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive creatures, backed up by a strong burn package of spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. The deck aims to apply pressure from the very beginning of the game, utilizing cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Goblin Bushwhacker to quickly build a threatening board presence. By keeping up the pressure and maintaining a fast pace, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using a variety of Sliver creatures. By combining creatures with abilities like boosting power and granting deathtouch, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and push for damage early on. The inclusion of cards like Lead the Stampede and Winding Way helps maintain card advantage, ensuring a steady stream of threats. Journey to Nowhere provides removal, while the mana base allows for consistent casting of spells.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Spellstutter Sprite while keeping the opponent's board under control with counterspells like Counterspell and removal like Lightning Bolt and Skred. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while dealing damage quickly with evasive creatures like Ninja of the Deep Hours. The deck also includes card draw spells like Preordain and Brainstorm to ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers.

The focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with cheap and evasive creatures like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with a suite of counter spells and card draw effects. By utilizing cards like Spellstutter Sprite to counter early threats and maintaining tempo with card advantage from cards like Snap and Tragic Lesson, this deck aims to overwhelm its opponent and close out the game as quickly as possible.

The main theme of this Dimir Control deck is to control the board and the opponent's resources through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to outvalue the opponent by using efficient creatures like Gurmag Angler and Augur of Bolas, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Foil and Dispel. The deck also incorporates graveyard synergies with cards like Thought Scour and Mystic Sanctuary, ultimately seeking to outmaneuver the opponent and grind out a victory through attrition and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Seeker of the Way and Guardian of the Guildpact, while also using combat tricks and removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Journey to Nowhere to control the board. The deck also includes token generation cards like Battle Screech to go wide and apply pressure. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and close out the game quickly through attacking and burn spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck utilizes cards like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to deal direct damage while creatures like Thraben Inspector and Glint Hawk provide early aggression. Additionally, cards like Journey to Nowhere and Palace Sentinels help control the board and maintain card advantage. The deck aims to apply pressure from the start and maintain it throughout the game, utilizing a mix of creatures, burn spells, and removal to secure victory.
